Package seng.monsters.ui.gui.state

Class State<T>

java.lang.Object
seng.monsters.ui.gui.state.State<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The type value of the state
public final class State<T> extends Object
State class similar to Observable pattern but much simpler.
  • Will perform callbacks on when set is called
  • Will not perform callback when value is mutated but not reassigned (i.e. a class has its nested properties changed)
  • Will not perform callback when value is reassigned to the same value
  • Suitable for storing primitives and immutable values

    • get

      public T get()
      Get the current value
      Returns:
      The value as of now

    • set

      public void set(T newState)
      Set the state with a brand new one.

      Will not perform anything if the new value is identical to the current one (based of Objects.equals

      Parameters:
      newState - The new value

    • set

      public void set(UnaryOperator<T> function)
      Set the state by applying a transformation to the current state. Careful with mutating the previous value, as it does not guarantee callback will be called
      Parameters:
      function - The operation to be performed

    • onChange

      public void onChange(Consumer<T> consumer)
      Apply a listener to always be called when the state has changed
      Parameters:
      consumer - The consumer function to reflect the new change
